faq.name: nofurtherinstances
faq.que: How can I prevent the creation of further program instances when I open other files from command line?
faq.ans: Prefix program arguments string with the special character @. See related section.

faq.name: sameframe
faq.keywords: load files in the same frame
faq.que: How can I load two files in the same plot frame?
faq.ans:
By mouse: drag the first file in plot area, then the second in the same frame of first file
By command line: specify the option -f (see here) as in the following example:
C:\> MattPlot -f file1.txt file2.txt

faq.name: rescaling
faq.que: Can I rescale (multiplication by a constant) my input data?
faq.ans:
You can do it at parsing time using text data file format, in particular the parser's Header directive, for example:
#header <y [0.5]> // following data will be // multiplied by 0.5 1 2 3
A more complex example:
#header <t[1E-3s]><V(t)[10V]><i(t)[0.1A-2]> 0.0 142.21 8.1 0.1 134.65 8.7 0.2 117.32 9.1
In this example we have three measures taken every 100us of a voltage and a current, the first expressed in tens of volt, the second in tenths of ampère; to the current is also applied an offset of -2 after rescaling (so this means -2A).
Remember that you can rescale tracks or perform other elaborations using the tool (see Transforming section).

faq.name: togglemode
faq.que: Can I temporary toggle to pan or zoom mode while measuring track?
faq.ans: Yes, use the PanToggle and ZoomToggle plot actions whose key shortcuts are defined in options file.

faq.name: fitview
faq.que: I zoomed too much, how can I reset plot view?
faq.ans: Use one of the following actions: , , ; set the shortcuts using option entries. Note that also some plot keys like cycle may perform fit operations; furthermore remember that during zoom mode you can reset scale with a mouse middle click.

faq.name: trackproperties
faq.que: I want to edit the properties of a track, but selection with mouse is difficult. Is there another way?
faq.ans: Select the track using plot keys and then fire the action.

faq.name: loggingcoords
faq.que: How can I record some point coordinates of a displayed track?
faq.ans: In measure mode you can record track points in the log; see related section.

faq.name: customshortcuts
faq.que: There is an action that I use often; is there a way to call it quickly avoiding the main menu?
faq.ans: Check if there is an available keyboard shortcut set in section of the option file, refer to string-key table to customize them.

faq.name: customtoolbar
faq.que: No shortcut available for my beloved action, Am I condemned to access it through the slow main menu for the rest of my life?
faq.ans: You can add a button on the toolbar. Edit the action names sequence in option. Get action names from the actions table or navigating main menu and looking at the statusbar hints.
